text.div:
SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonCS CodeSystem

An explanation of why the observation was not made (or ordered), i.e., why test was not ordered, or why a question was not asked. Since an observation is really a type of procedure, reasons that an observation was not carried out are similar to reasons any procedure might not be carried out.

name: SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonCS CodeSystem
title: SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonCS CodeSystem
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: An explanation of why the observation was not made (or ordered), i.e., why test was not ordered, or why a question was not asked. Since an observation is really a type of procedure, reasons that an observation was not carried out are similar to reasons any procedure might not be carried out.

concept.display: The question or data element is not applicable, or based on other answers, no answer to this question is required.
concept.definition: The question or data element is not applicable, or based on other answers, no answer to this question is required.

concept.display: The test or observation is contraindicated, i.e., the subject is intolerant or at risk of an adverse reaction if subjected to the test or observation.
concept.definition: The test or observation is contraindicated, i.e., the subject is intolerant or at risk of an adverse reaction if subjected to the test or observation.

concept.display: The observation has made previously, or a previous test result is available, a new  test or observation would be redundant.
concept.definition: The observation has made previously, or a previous test result is available, a new  test or observation would be redundant.

concept.display: The observation would be too costly.
concept.definition: The observation would be too costly.
